page.title: 10Buxhall - Local Employment
page.content: Within Buxhall there are{3 non-farming {employers}providing work for 22 persons: an{agricultural engineer, boarding and breeding{kennels}and a {plastic extrusion}and fabrication business. The latter was established in 1979 on a site outside the village. The owners had run a pig unit on the site and wished to diversify. The business originally produced flooring and accessories for animal units but has expanded to include components for the motor industry. Initially the rural location was convenient as much of the market was with local farmers. Subsequently the accessibility of the A45 has facilitated the firms expansion into national and international markets. Works transport is provided to enable employees to travel from Ipswich each day.
